5. Modules provided on the Platform






    The services rendered and the data provided on the Platform are categorized in four (4) modules:






    5.1. Homepage / ‘Flows Map’ Module:



    The appygas ‘Flows Map’ module displays a European map showing gas flows for a selected time period for interconnection points on a virtual level between two market areas, virtual storages, production points and LNG terminals. A ‘Usage’ mode allows a visualization of usage rates for each point as well as filling levels for storage facilities and terminals. By clicking on a market area, Registered Users access a detailed view with more information (if available), such as consumption, network imbalance and spot prices on the market area level. From this view, the Registered User can access a further level of information providing more data such as nominations, technical and available capacities. Below the European map on the start page, some widgets provide Registered Users with additional information, such as the maintenance works at specific interconnection points, hub prices as well as pipeline and LNG supply in Europe for the selected period.






    5.2. ‘Availability’ Module: The appygas ‘Availability’ Module offers Registered Users two different views for maintenance works at pipelines: a European map on which a maintenance symbol indicates planned maintenance works at the Virtual Interconnection Point during the selected period, and a view with a list of maintenance works for preselected market areas. Clicking on a market area or on a physical point provides Registered Users with more details about the maintenance such as the remaining available capacity.






    5.3. ‘Route Calculator’ Module: The appygas ‘Route Calculator’ Module offers the Registered User the possibility to calculate the transport price between two (or, in later versions already covered by these Terms, more) selected market areas according to predefined parameters like quantity, transport period, auction product and capacity quality. The results are displayed in a list sorted by price (increasing) and can be downloaded as an excel file. At the top, the Registered User can see the selected market areas as a mini map with the hub prices related to the transport period. The calculator indicates the next auction on the primary capacity platform and allows the Registered User to send themselves a reminder to their calendar. Additionally, the auction results of the latest corresponding monthly and daily auctions on the web auctioning service of Prisma European Capacity Platform GmbH ( “Prisma”) are displayed in a graph showing the offered and sold capacity during the auction as well as the surcharge price.






    5.4. ‘Trades’ Module: The appygas ‘Trades’ module offers Registered Users with EIC code the possibility of publishing information about transport capacity they would like to sell or buy. Registered Users can contact the contact person mentioned in the publication directly. In case of an anonymous publication via appygas, the platform will transmit the request with contact details to the publisher of said information. Appygas merely serves as a means of communication for market participants. Any assignment or transfer of use will be performed via secondary market platforms such as Prisma. Appygas reserves the right to refuse publication of offers without giving reason, in particular if doubts occur concerning the User’s power of representation of their company. Where messages are being forwarded to recipients (in particular in case of anonymous publications), appygas will not take note of their contents or review them. By forwarding messages, appygas does not enter into any contractual, pre-contractual, or quasi-contractual special relationship with the sender or the recipient concerning the assignment or transfer of use of capacity.






6. General Use






    6.1. Use of the Platform is strictly limited to its destined functions. Any inappropriate or illegal use, manipulation, or amendments of the Platform is prohibited. It is particularly, but not exclusively, forbidden to use the Platform







      6.1.1. to carry out or to support anticompetitive practices, including advertisement for other information services or utilities in general;




      6.1.2. to copy or to read out contents like offers, tables, or data sets for commercial uses, except for the proper use according to these Terms;



      6.1.3. to use pornographic, insulting, offensive, sexist, racist, threatening, youth protection law infringing, or other illegal or immoral contents or to advertise, offer, or sell such products;



      6.1.4. to use malware;



      6.1.5. to upload contents that affect or infringe the rights of third parties or that are covered by copyrights, unless the User owns the respective copyright or has the permission of the copyright owner;



      6.1.6. to influence the availability of the Platform or the services provided by appygas in a negative way for other Users, including the interception of messages, the transmission of junk mail and/or false information or data, and the transmission of messages for own commercial purposes;



      6.1.7. to use temporary e-mail addresses;



      6.1.8. to provide false names, addresses, telephone numbers, facsimile numbers, e-mail addresses, member names, or other data of messenger services;



      6.1.9. to resale or forward any contents, including details of other members provided in the ‘Trades’ module, to third parties.





    6.2. If a User violates these Terms, appygas may restrict, block, and/or delete the respective account. When choosing between said measures, appygas will consider the relevance of the inappropriate use, the legitimate interest of the User, and the degree of responsibility of the User. During the analysis of the circumstances, appygas may temporarily block an account, delete single and/or all licenses of the respective User, warn the User, or restrict their use of the Platform.





    6.3. Use of the Platform is subject to the current state of technology. Appygas may limit its services due to capacity limits, requirements of the security or integrity of the server or the performance of technical features or if the limitation serves the proper or improved provision of services. Appygas services may therefore be temporarily or partially interrupted.








7. Content from Users






    Users may provide their own content, e.g. ratings. By submitting their own content, Users grant appygas all rights of use regarding the handling and publishing of that content. This also applies to partial handling and publishing. The rights of use are unrestricted in time, range, and content.






8. Termination






    8.1. Registered Users may terminate their membership without giving reason with a notice period of one month to the end of the twelve months period beginning with the commencement date specified by appygas pursuant to sec. 4 of these Terms. Termination must be declared explicitly by email to team@appygas.com or by letter to the address of appygas as indicated above under section 1.






    8.2. Appygas may terminate a membership of a Registered User without giving reason with a notice period of one month to the end of the twelve months period beginning with the commencement date of the payment period specified by appygas pursuant to sec. 4 of these Terms. Termination must be declared explicitly by e-mail to the respective Registered User’s email address or by letter to the respective Registered User’s mail address.






    8.3. The right of termination for cause and without notice remains unaffected. A termination for cause shall be given in any case of a violation of the duties under these Terms.






9. Privacy Policy




    The User agrees to the terms of appygas´ Privacy Policy available at http://appygas.com/privacy-policy.html.






10. Rights of third parties




    Some contents of the Platform are protected under data privacy law, copyright law, or trademark law. Contents must not be copied, promoted, reproduced, forwarded, resold or otherwise be used without permission of the respective owner of rights except for the use of the Platform according to these Terms. This particularly applies to the use of robots, crawlers, or other automatic techniques.

  5. Innovation from Irvine, CA:



    The Masimo SafetyNet, originally designed for opioid patients, is a wearable similar to a wristwatch with a disposable fingertip attachment usable either by patients in traditional or ad hoc hospital beds, or by sick individuals who have been seen and sent home. It continuously monitors a patient’s pulse, breathing, and blood oxygen levels. If it detects shallow breathing or an unnaturally slow or accelerated pulse, it alerts caregivers and hospital staff. 1. The Department of Labor released the required notice for the Families First Coronavirus Response Act today. All employers covered by the FFCRA must post the notice in a conspicuous place to advise all current employees of their rights under the Act. The FFCRA, which was passed by Congress and signed by President Trump last week, expands employee leave laws in response to the COVID-19 crisis. Download Here




2. The burden is now on employers to show that a Covid infection did not take place in the workplace in order to overcome the presumption that a Covid-19 case qualifies for worker's compensation. https://gradyfirm.wordpress.com/2020/05/08/how-will-covid-19-affect-workers-compensation-claims-in-california/






​​​​​​​




  1. Here is a good article on managing a remote work force, with more than the basic considerations. Determine how often you will check in with employees, and how deadlines will work. Do they have the right #equipment? What are the bottlenecks? What technology are they using?



  2. Are you reimbursing telecommuting employees for their reasonably-incurred business-related expenses, like cell phone, Internet connection, paper, pens, staples, and supplies, etc.? Is this reflected on their wage statements? See our blog on cell phone reimbursement in California. We can help you create a reimbursement policy and determine the amount to pay the employee.



  3. Have you posted this required flyer at your business in the break room or a conspicuous place? Once an employer registers with the Employment Development Department (EDD), they receive a notice to post, which informs their employees of their rights under the Unemployment Insurance (UI), Disability Insurance (DI), and Paid Family Leave (PFL) programs. This notice must be posted in a prominent location that is easily seen by the employees. Employers receive the following notice if they are subject to: Unemployment Insurance, Disabiltiy Insurance, and/or Paid Family Leave [Download Here] ​


    ​


  4. If your business has been shutdown tonight by government order, please explore unemployment and disability insurance options for yourself or your employees. Read our blog about "Mitigating the Impact of Coronavirus in the Workplace." ​​ ​​ ​


    ​


  5. USCIS Suspends Interviews and Premium Processing for Cap H-1B Cases, Consulates Suspend or Limit Visa Interviews Note: USCIS usually suspends premium processing for a period of time during H-1B season, so that's not new. However, suspended interview times could lead to longer wait times once this service resumes. Read More




  6. If you send employees home from work due to illness or lack of work, they may be entitled to Reporting Time Pay. Check the rules in your state. Here are the rules for California.​


    ​


  7. Los Angeles employer update: If you have 500 employees working within the City of Los Angeles, or 2,000 across the US, you may have to provide up to 80 hours of Paid Sick Leave to your employees, up to $511 per day, or $5,110 in the aggregate. Learn what scenarios qualify an #employee for this leave under the Mayor's order. Download Here​

Be sure to take in the striking cliff-side views of the coastline up against the green backdrop of the Sierra Madre mountains.




GPS land coordinates:

20°33'36.9 "N 105°15'21.6 "W



Carretera. Costera a Barra de Navidad Km. 5, 48390 Puerto Vallarta, Jalisco



https://goo.gl/maps/ugbsb52Yjvin7oeg7






​​








Fun facts:





-Once a small fishing village, today the greater Vallarta area stretches ºfor nearly 30 miles along the shores of Banderas Bay, one of the world’s largest bays.





-Puerto Vallarta (airport code: PVR) is home to 515,000+ inhabitants, as of 2020 (source). PVR is one of 125 municipalities in the Mexican coastal state of Jalisco.





-Guadalajara (airport code GDL) is the nearest metropolitan city (215 miles / 347 km away), the second-largest city in Mexico, and Jalisco’s state capital. GDL is also known as the “Pearl of the West” and has a population of 1.5 million inhabitants.





-We will be opening an office in PV’s Romantic Zone soon. Stay tuned for updates!

The Evergreen Community Initiatives runs programs such as The Place of Peace (community meal and food pantry for those in need), the Kids Closet (children's clothing pantry), Tree Huggers (scarf project to keep the homeless and people struggling with poverty warm), and the Warming Center (winter shelter for the homeless).





PHONE: 715-252-7860 Monday through Friday 10AM – 2PM



ADDRESS - 1948 Church St. (two blocks North of Belt’s Ice Cream on the oneway).



The doors open at 4:30 PM and dinner is served at 5:00 PM every Thursday except Thanksgiving. All are welcome, please feel free to join us.

Chaturbate se enorgullece de la libertad que brinda a las emisoras para que puedan personalizar sus páginas de cámara y expresarse con superposiciones y gráficos. Dicho esto, esta libertad solo puede extenderse hasta ahora y, en última instancia, no debe interferir con la funcionalidad principal de nuestro sitio web.





Su página no debe presentar superposiciones que oculten el logotipo de nuestro sitio, las zonas de anuncios o cualquier elemento de navegación.





Si su cuenta está marcada como que usa este tipo de elementos, le avisaremos amablemente para eliminarlos o reubicarlos. Si no los elimina y recibe advertencias adicionales de nuestra parte, tendremos que tomar medidas más serias.

Locust wood can be pale yellow to darker brown in color and tends to darken with age. It has medium and straight grain. It can be hard to work with due to its hardness, but it finishes well. Generally used for flooring, furniture, fenceposts, decking and even boatbuilding.




For more information:



http://www.wood-database.com/black-locust/​

​​



​

Poplar wood is light cream to yellwoish brown in color. It has straight, uniform grain with medium texture. It is very easy to work with, although due to its softness it may leave fuzzy edges when cutting/sanding. Poplar is used mainly as a utility wood; it is used in furniture frames, crates, and other strctural uses. However, it can be stained to resemble more expensive woods.




For more information:



http://www.wood-database.com/poplar/​

​​



​

Sycamore wood ranges from white and light tan to darker reddish brown. It has a very fine and even texture, and is easy to work with. It also finishes well. Quartersawn sycamore has a freckled appearance due to ray flecks in the wood.





Rare live edge slabs available



Starting at $47




For more information:



http://www.wood-database.com/sycamore/​

​​



​

​​










The Green Door has been operating since 2003 and their SOMA location since 2005. They also offer delivery in SF, the Peninsula and East Bay. Cash/Debit is accepted in store, delivery is cash only.





All delivery orders require a $50 minimum purchase. For SF Peninsula the $5 Delivery fee is temporarily waived. For the East Bay all orders under $200 will be charged a $7 toll fee.







Temporary Store Hours 10 am - 8 pm Daily and Delivery until 7:30 pm Daily.

Service Type: Spiritual Services/Life Coach




Service Provider: Chelsea




Website: www.misfitmystics11.com




Service Description:




Spiritual mentorship is a valuable service for all who seek growth and progress on their path of choice. Spirituality is an, often overlooked, important aspect of wellbeing. Those of us with a thriving sense of spirituality tend to have a greater sense of purpose. We can handle adverse events with fortitude and look at life with a sense of awe and optimism.




Progression can be overwhelming, regardless. I will help you identify your personal challenges and spiritual blockages while guiding you to a deeper understanding of what spirituality looks like to you. You determine what you desire from mentorship and I will support you by developing a plan to connect to your inherent power and ability to overcome your shadow work.




Together, we can creae a system or practice that has the sustenance for you to continue progressing in your spirituality. Using techniques that include, but aren't limited to: journaling, meditation, guided mindfulness and cognitive restructuring, tarot and more. There will be assignments along with sessions in order to gain clarity and better process your shadows as well as your light.
